Detailed Description

GUI-based trajectory generation from sliders.

The class SliderTrajectoryGenerator creates a trajectory that is manually created by the user in a GUI. In that GUI, the user moves a slider for each joint and controls the joint position of the manipulator directly.

Note that the widgets are not created at object construction. They are created when the function reset() is called. If no parent is set (default), the sliders are created inside a window.

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: Robotic Platform
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package: Trajectory Generator Classes
// Authors: Markus Loffler
// Start Date: Fri Apr 20 11:40:15 GMT 2001
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: SliderSliderTrajectoryGenerator.t.cpp
// Example program for the class SliderSliderTrajectoryGenerator.
//========================================================================  
 

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>

// ----- QRTS Libraries -----

// ----- Project Includes -----
#include "RoboticPlatform.hpp"
#include "SliderTrajectoryGenerator.hpp"
#include "Puma560.hpp"

 
 
//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  
 
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
  RoboticPlatform::init(argc, argv);
  
  SliderTrajectoryGenerator sliderTragen;
  
  Puma560 puma;
  puma.setTrajectoryGenerator(sliderTragen);

  sleep(2000);
  
  return 0;
}

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SliderTrajectoryGenerator ( const char * objectName )
 

This constructor allows you to specify the object name. If the section in the global configuration file specified by the object name has the class name "SliderTrajectoryGenerator", then the settings of this section are used to setup the object.

Note that the GUI is not created at this point, the function createWidgets() has to be called explicitly after constructing the object.

Parameters:
objectName   Object name, identical with the section name in the global configuration file.

SliderTrajectoryGenerator ( int numInConfig = 1 )
 

This constructor allows you to specify the number of the object in the global configuration file that specifies the class name "SliderTrajectoryGenerator". The settings of this object in the global configuration are used to setup the object.

Note that the GUI is not created at this point, the function createWidgets() has to be called explicitly after constructing the object.

Parameters:
numInConfig   Number of the object in the global configuration file (only objects of the correct class type are counted), starting at "1".

SliderTrajectoryGenerator ( const TypeInfo * parent ) [protected]
 

The constructor initializes the class. Note that the GUI is not created at this point, the function createWidgets() has to be called explicitly after constructing the object.

Note that this constructor is protected, i.e., it is only called from the constructor of a derived class.

~SliderTrajectoryGenerator ( ) [virtual]
 

The destructor cleans up.

Reimplemented from TrajectoryGenerator.

void setParentWidget ( CWidget * parent )
 

Sets the parent widget of the sliders.

Parameters:
parent   The parent widget, all sliders are created as children of this parent.

bool getCurrentSetpoint ( VectorBase<>& setpointJoint,
Transform & setpointCartesian,
int & configuration ) [virtual]
 

Returns the current setpoint in joint coordinates, according to the current slider positions.

Parameters:
setpointJoint   The current setpoint in joint coordinates.
setpointCartesian   Not used.
configuration   Not used.
Returns:
Always false, indicating that the current setpoint is in joint coordinates.

Reimplemented from TrajectoryGenerator.

void reset ( Manipulator * manipulator = 0 ) [virtual]
 

This function initializes the trajectory generator with the current manipulator position and do other initalization (e.g., reinitialize the motion queue). This is also the point where the GUI widgets are created.

Reimplemented from TrajectoryGenerator.

double getCurrentSetpointSamplePeriod ( ) [virtual]
 

Returns a low value, indicating that a lot of filtering is necessary to smooth the trajectory created by moving the sliders.

Returns:
The maximum expected setpoint sample period.

Reimplemented from TrajectoryGenerator.

VectorBase * createJointVector ( ) [virtual]
 

This function is not implemented.

Returns:
0.

Reimplemented from TrajectoryGenerator.

int getNumJoints ( ) [virtual]
 

Determines the number of joints that the trajectory generator uses.

Returns:
The number of joints.

Reimplemented from TrajectoryGenerator.
